note: Subject (Kant, Hegel, Marx, Adorno): that which experiences.

title: Sublime (Kant): aesthetic beauty that transcends sensory experience
Althusser): the sphere of ideas; in Engels and Althusser it is supported by the material ‘base’

title: The Ideology of the Aesthetic; Basil Blackwell Ltd; Oxford

title: The Reign of Ideology

note: Traces the evolution of various forms of ideology, as well as considering the phenomenon as a whole.
title: The Philosophic Roots of Modern Ideology: Liberalism, Communism, Fascism

note: Penetrating and undogmatic historical account of ideology’s various permutations.
title: The Concept of Ideology

note: Defines it against the rival force of ‘utopia’.
title: Ideology and Utopia
Brilliant early attempt to theorize ideology across various periods

note: Detailed historical argument denying that ideology can be identified with false consciousness.
title: schematic but extremely lucid outline of the topic, which addresses the issue of its continuing relevance.] 200 further reading
